sentence.text: Three SCAR markers (apoptotic nuclear changes-1, BC13-4 and BC31-2) had high levels of genomic DNA amplification in breast cancer.

The glycogen metabolic process and histone monoubiquitination genes are either overlapping or close to the sequences of SCAR marker BC13-4, while SCAR marker apoptotic nuclear changes-1 is in the intron and overlap the antibiotic metabolic process gene, suggesting that alterations in the expression of these genes could contribute to cancer progression.

Screening of breast cancer cell lines showed that the mRNA expression levels for the glycogen metabolic process and antibiotic metabolic process were lower in non-tumorigenic mammary epithelial cell MCF10A, but elevated in other cell lines.
Furthermore, SCAR markers apoptotic nuclear changes-1 and BC13-4 might be useful diagnostic markers for breast cancer carcinomas
